physical_examinations.relevant_findings: General examination was normal. Ophthalmoscopy revealed early cataracts, retinitis pigmentosa, and optic atrophy. Marked postural and intention tremor of all limbs but no gait ataxia. There were no extrapyramidal signs. Grade 4 pyramidal weakness throughout and hyperreflexia but flexor plantar responses.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: During the evaluation period, the patient's visual acuity deteriorated to hand movements on the right and counting fingers on the left, leading to registration as blind. She was discharged 6 months later with mild hemiparesis, walking with a frame.
